whatIsRem.title: What are PX and REM?
whatIsRem.content: PX (pixel) is a fixed unit, while REM (root em) is relative to the root element's font size, typically 16px by default in most browsers.

whyUseRem.title: Why use REM?
whyUseRem.content: REM units are ideal for creating accessible, responsive designs that scale proportionally when users change their browser's font size.

howToUse.title: How to use REM in CSS
howToUse.content: Define the root font size on the html element, then use rem units for font sizes, margins, padding, and other properties.
